alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 1:55AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until 130 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Elevated river and stream flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 142 AM AKDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.4 to 0.7 inches are possible. At 1:30 am, rainfall rates of 0.2 to 0.3 inches per hours are occurring across northern and western Anchorage and is expected to continue for at least the next one to two hours. - For Campbell Creek near Dimond: At 1:15am the stage was 19.39 feet. Flood Stage is 20.5 feet. For Chester Creek at Arctic Blvd: At 1:15am the stage was 4.51 feet. Flood Stage is 4.0 feet. Impacts: At 22.0 feet: Flooding of bike path along Campbell Creek from Lake Otis to Victor/Dimond. Jim`s Burgers floods. Water in the yard of residence just upstream of Campbell Campbell Creek and Dowling. At 4.0 feet: Portions of the Chester Creek Bike Path will get inundated, especially beneath the C St Bridge Chester Creek Forecast: A crest around 4.8 feet is expected around 10:00am Wednesday. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along Chester and Campbell Creeks stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
